Unlock Vital Intelligence Information

Enable users to access needed  data to make informed decisions.
Open standards and modularity break down third party proprietary restrictions.

Advance intelligence in the 21st century

Provide secure, distributed intelligence processing capabilities. 
Open source software and open development methods replace the historical paradigm of slow development to adapt as new risks and challenges arise.

Enable Efficient Search & Discovery for the Intelligence Community

Access vast amounts of imagery and data to perform the mission. 
Distributed Data Framework is an open and agile architecture, enabling a plug-and-play-type environment to integrate many sources out of the box.

Advance the DCGS Family of Systems

Securely share intelligence across organizations.  
The DCGS Integration Backbone DIB promotes collaborative use of discovered data by analysts to produce enhanced ISR products. 

Understand the Importance of Coalition Partners

Address today’s global threats through international collaboration.  
Our Collaborative Agile Gateway Environment connects partner nations; Alliance extensions support international standards and interoperability with the Coalition Shared Dataserver.

Advancing intelligence
in the 21st century

We leverage open source software and open development to provide secure and distributed intelligence capabilities to our customers.

Securely Integrate Systems to Create Knowledge

We provide industry-leading solutions to integrate IT systems
using open, extensible technologies.

Connexta manages the open source DDF baseline, and provides enterprise solutions and technical support for DDF installations.

Featured Programs

We specialize in the secure integration of data, applications, and services with a proven track record of supporting DoD, IC, and international partners with over 5 years of operational experience. Connexta is the prime contractor for DDF Integration Backbone and provides software development and integration support to the DCGS Programs of Record.

UK MOD

Imagery Exploitation Programme

“In order to support CFACC [Combined Forces Air Combat Commander] intelligence needs, AF DCGS must be able to conduct time-dominant and decision-quality analysis to optimize ISR operations, produce timely assessments and enhance battlespace awareness and threat warnings,” said Lt. Col. Joshua P. Williams, AF DCGS Branch materiel leader. “To ensure rapid response to changing threats and intelligence, our team worked to develop an open and agile architecture, enabling a plug-and-play-type environment.” Source: 2016 Open Architecture Benefits DCGS

Mission critical software services require international collaboration.
